channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates for Wednesday 19 August
item.description: While a small support team and extra defence force aid have been announced, the prime minister is firm that as things currently stand there won't be a move to alert level 4.

item.title: Six new cases of Covid-19 in NZ today - five in community, one imported case
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says there are no additional cases related to the Rydges Hotel maintenance worker who tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: I was filmed in a Kmart changing cubicle
item.description: When a stranger videoed Veronica Schmidt undressed in a changing room, the store's staff refused to call police. Here she writes about what it took to finally get the offender in front of a judge.

item.title: Covid-19: 40% of isolation staff tested before Auckland outbreak
item.description: Only 40 percent of staff working in managed isolation and quarantine facilities were tested prior to last week's Covid-19 community outbreak in Auckland.

item.title: Auckland lockdown affecting businesses throughout NZ
item.description: Many businesses outside of Auckland say they're struggling - and some are closing up - as they're cut off from the country's largest city, and it's population of 1.6 million.

item.title: More than 8900 critical buildings in tsunami evacuation zones - report
item.description: Nearly one in ten New Zealanders live in a tsunami evacuation zone.

item.title: Global facial recognition company working closely with NZ govt
item.description: A major company at the centre of controversies over facial recognition technology in the US and UK is working closely with the New Zealand government.

item.title: 'We've certainly got capacity': Megan Woods on space for positive cases at Covid-19 quarantine facility
item.description: Minister in charge of managed isolation Megan Woods says at the moment there are no cases connected to the Rydges Hotel maintenance worker.

item.title: Wild weather: Heavy rain warnings for Northland, Coromandel
item.description: It's a wet and windy day for many places today, as a front moves east across the country.

item.title: Construction workers take boss to ERA over unpaid wages
item.description: A group of Chinese workers claim they've been left out of pocket to the tune of tens of thousands of dollars after a former employer failed to pay their wages in full.

item.title: Waiting times down at Covid-19 Auckland checkpoints, police say
item.description: The Police Assistant Commissioner says waiting times at Auckland checkpoints are down and more motorists are turning up with the documents needed.

item.title: Covid-19: Govt urged to do serology tests on border and isolation workers
item.description: A special type of blood test could give vital clues as to how an isolation hotel maintenance worker got Covid-19 from a woman he had never met.

item.title: Deadline for businesses to display Covid Tracer QR code
item.description: Businesses have until noon today to display the government's Covid Tracer QR code before it becomes mandatory.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 18 August
item.description: It's been a busy day for Covid-19 news, and among it has been the mystery of how a worker contracted the virus, a security guard sharing returnee details via an app and a reporter finding the source of rumours about the South Auckland cluster.

item.title: Second NZ Post worker tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: New Zealand Post has confirmed a second worker at the Auckland Operations Centre in Highbrook has returned a positive Covid-19 test.

item.title: Residents caught between border forced to break Covid-19 restrictions to get food
item.description: Some residents in northern Waikato are having to break Covid-19 border restrictions in order to buy food.

item.title: Security guard suspended after breach at managed isolation
item.description: The minister in charge of managed isolation says she's confident the right processes were followed after a privacy breach at one of the facilities.

item.title: Finding the man behind the covid outbreak rumour
item.description: The man at the centre of rumours about a Covid-19 positive family that were condemned by the health minister has expressed regret after being tracked down.
